vocabulary.definition: important or large enough to have an effect
vocabulary.example: There was a significant increase in sales last year.

vocabulary.definition: to distribute resources or duties for a purpose
vocabulary.example: The government allocated more funds to education.

vocabulary.definition: to give special importance to something
vocabulary.example: Teachers often emphasize the importance of practice.

vocabulary.definition: to decrease or become weaker
vocabulary.example: Birth rates have declined in many developed countries.

vocabulary.definition: the basic systems and services of a country such as roads and power supplies
vocabulary.example: Improving public infrastructure is essential for economic growth.

vocabulary.definition: something you give or do to help achieve a goal
vocabulary.example: His contribution to the project was highly valued.

vocabulary.definition: able to be maintained over a long period without harming the environment
vocabulary.example: Sustainable energy sources are becoming more popular.

vocabulary.definition: a method or way of doing something
vocabulary.example: We need a new approach to solving traffic problems.

vocabulary.definition: an idea suggested as a possible explanation for something
vocabulary.example: The scientist tested her hypothesis with several experiments.

vocabulary.definition: to use something, especially resources or food
vocabulary.example: Modern households consume large amounts of electricity.

vocabulary.definition: to improve or make something better
vocabulary.example: The new software enhances the performance of the device.

vocabulary.definition: to appear or become known
vocabulary.example: New technologies continue to emerge each year.

vocabulary.definition: certain to happen; unavoidable
vocabulary.example: Change is inevitable in every industry.

vocabulary.definition: correct and without mistakes
vocabulary.example: The report contains accurate and up-to-date information.

vocabulary.definition: to influence or change something
vocabulary.example: Weather can affect transportation systems.

vocabulary.definition: to increase in size or amount
vocabulary.example: The company plans to expand into Asian markets.

vocabulary.definition: to explain the meaning of something
vocabulary.example: Students must interpret data in the graph.

vocabulary.definition: to continue at the same level or keep something in good condition
vocabulary.example: It is difficult to maintain a healthy lifestyle.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to develop or succeed
vocabulary.example: The new system has great potential to improve efficiency.

vocabulary.definition: a strong effect on something or someone
vocabulary.example: Climate change has a major impact on agriculture.
